details: w jumps to the next word start, b goes back, e goes to the word end. Counts work: 3w.
0 goes to column 1, ^ goes to first non-blank, $ goes to end.

summary: Jump to file edges with gg and G.
details: gg goes to the first line, G to the last. Use 42gg for line 42.

summary: Find characters on the line with f/F.
details: f{char} jumps forward, F{char} goes backward. Repeat with ; and ,.
Works for (), {}, and [] when the cursor is on a pair.

summary: Keep the cursor centered with zz.
details: zz recenters the view; zt puts the line at top, zb at bottom.
dd deletes the current line; 3dd deletes three lines.
ciw is "change inner word": delete the word and enter insert mode.

summary: Change to end of line with C.
details: C deletes from the cursor to line end and enters insert mode.
o opens below, O opens above, both enter insert mode.
r{char} replaces the char under the cursor without insert mode.
. repeats the last edit, a huge time-saver.

summary: Yank and paste lines with yy and p/P.
details: yy yanks a line; p pastes after, P pastes before.

summary: Use the system clipboard with "+y and "+p.
details: "+y yanks to clipboard; "+p pastes from it.
:reg shows register contents, including yanks and deletes.
/pattern searches forward, ?pattern searches backward. Use n and N to repeat.

summary: Search word under cursor with * and #.
details: * searches forward for the word, # searches backward.
:noh removes the search highlight when you are done.
Replaces all matches in the current line.
Replaces all matches in the file.
Adds a confirm prompt per match.

summary: Undo and redo with u and Ctrl+r.
details: u undoes one change; Ctrl+r redoes it.
vi" selects inside quotes; ci" changes inside.
vi) selects inside (); ci) changes inside.
vip selects a paragraph; vap includes blank lines.
Use in Visual mode to indent or outdent.
=ip indents a paragraph; == indents the current line.
:ls lists buffers; :bnext and :bprev move between them.
:bd closes the current buffer without closing the window.
Use Ctrl+w then arrow or hjkl to move between splits.
:tabnew opens a tab; gt/gT move between tabs.
:w saves, :q quits, :wq saves and quits.
:e path/to/file edits a file in the current window.

summary: Insert file or command output with :r.
details: :r file inserts a file; :r !cmd inserts output.
:help {topic} opens help, e.g., :help motions.
q{reg} starts recording, q stops, @{reg} replays.
@@ replays the last macro again.
